description.en: In this exciting challenge you will learn how to program your robot. The sky is the limit, you have got endless options to make your robot move, play tunes or use its sensors. To start programmming choose the 'robots' card in your main menu.
You can see your tool-list on the left of the screen. Let's go one by one, first, click on 'motors'.
Once you clicked on 'motors', the following options will come up. To choose between the drive, turn or motor programmings, you just easily need to click on one of the.
If you want to do sensory programmings, you will need to choose from the next list.
'Within loops' you can choose from commands that will transform the previous steps into routines saving time for you.
Under the 'logic' card you will find some further command-influential parts.
Within 'time' you can set breaks for example.
Here you can add mathematical commands.
You can also find a card under which you can create variables just like the pros.
Finally, you find the f(x) functions card.
Now let's go back to the 'motors' card and click on the very first option, 'drive'.
Once you selected the card you can change the date within. Let's change the number of seconds our robot will drive forward. To do so, you need to click on the number '3' first.
Once you clicked on the number, the following image will come up. You can change the number by deleting the original one and giving your new number.
Here we change the driving lenght to 4 seconds. To finish, click on OK.
Now let's add a loop to our drive command. We choose the first option this time.
Once you choose a repeat command, you can add it your previous command or commands. Here, you need to add the number of repetation you would like to have. Let's delete zero and add your choice.
We choose number 4 again. To apply, press OK.
To continue, let's go back to 'motors' and pick the second command.
Once you clicked on it, the command will be added to your list. Let's embed it into your repeat command. It means your robot will turn left in 90 degrees four times, making it a full circle.
Let's click on 'motors' one more time, and pick 'turn left' again.
Once the command is added to your list, click on it to change direction.
The following image should come up, here you need to click on option 'right'.
However, you can also change the degree of the turn. To apply the change, click on the given number, then delete 90 and add the number of your preference. Finally, press OK.
We change the original 90 degrees to 180, so a half circle.
Let's add a short pause as well. Click on 'time and let's choose the first order.
Attach your new command to the list and change the number of seconds as well. To do so, click on number 1.
Delete number 1 with the same procedure you did before.
We will change the time for 5 seconds.
Finally, let's play with th sensors! Once you clicked on the card, let's pick 'play tune'.
Once it is visible among your chosen programs, attach it at the end. Once you have your list of commands you need to save your program. To do so, let's click on the save image.
Next, you need to name your program. Tap in and type the name. You can also add its description as well if you wish.
Once you named your program ó, press 'Done'.
As your next step, you need to go to your main menu where you can find 'robots'. Click on it.
Within robots, choose the robot you want to program. Here we have Revvy. You need to click on the pencil image to apply your saved programs.
Once clicking on the pencil, you will see the following screen. Here you need to switch to 'Controller' by clicking on it.

Now you are within the Controller Menu where you can find the programmed and empty buttons. You can add your program to any of the empty buttons by clicking onto 'empty'. Let's pick the first one this time.
Once you clicked on the word empty belonging to the button you are about to program, you will see the written programs found on your device. Let's pick the one you have just saved.
Now your proram is added to the button of your choice. let's click on the button!
Next, you will need to click on 'Start' as this message comes up.

Your device will search for your robot via Bluetooth, so make sure both your robot and bluetooth on your device are on. If you have more robots, you need to choose the name identical with the serial number at the back of your robot. If you have one robot, just click on the one that appears, it must be the serial number of your robot, unless there's no other robot nearby.
Once you choose your robot, the following disappearing message will come up.
Aaaand, voila! Your program is visible and added to the button of your preference. Now let's play! Push the button and see what you have just achieved. Hurray!!!!
